heaviest_rainfall.status: The largest amount of rain ever recorded is on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm fell at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour over the 37.2 hour event.

heaviest_rainrate.status: 27.0mm per hour is the maximum rain rate ever recorded on 02 September 2025, during a 15.0 hour storm which dumped 21.19mm of rain from the clouds.

longest_rain.status: On 04 January 2025, the rain lasted for 37.2 hours, which is the longest time recorded by our database.  36.8mm accumulated and it fell at 4.6mm per hour at times.

most_lightning.status: Since records began on 11 April 2025, the highest lightning strike count in one day is 23 on 07 September 2025.

storm.status: No storm activity at the moment.  The previous storm occurred on 28 September 2025 and lasted 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is currently no cold snap.  This year there have been 6 cold snaps, usually there are 3.7 cold snaps per year.

extreme.status: The record temperature difference stands at 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C), set on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is not a heatwaves right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 1.9.

tropical.status: The last observed tropical night was 18 July 2025, making a total of only 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (179°), which differs from the daily average south-westerly (232.0°) by approximately 53.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The largest wind gust ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

run.status: The top recorded wind run is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind speed recorded on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 6.0°C) and outside temperature (down 5.3°C) and more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 8%).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 679 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in feels like temperature (up 51.0°C), dew point temperature (up 47.2°C), outside temperature (up 50.9°C), and cloud levels (up 431 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 678.7m lower than yesterday, 431.0m lower than the past week, 292.8m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels yesterday fell between 1184m minimum and 3910m maximum, with an average of 1435.4m; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 1866.4m and 1728.2m.
cloud levels.summary: The sky may alternate between sunny and overcast.

summary.summary: Inside; temperature should feel pleasantly mild. Outside; cold spells are likely. Also, the air will feel dry and little or no wind. Drizzle or light rain possible, the sky may alternate between sunny and overcast, and the light is absent. The weather will likely remain the same.

washing.phrase: The current temperature is too low (3.6°C) for optimal drying conditions.  Any drying will take longer.
